posts.cooked:
Hello, looked at other issues in the forum. Nothing is working so far. So I had to create a new issue if that’s okay.

Location: Lebanon.
Network: MTC Touch
Device: Samsung

Tried steps on signal’s website like turning off battery optim. too. didn’t work.

I found this article and not sure if relevant but it’s somewhat recent…

link_counts.title: Lebanon’s telecom feud disrupts SMS verification system - SMEX

posts.cooked:
i think article says key point this time:

According to Abed Kataya, Media Program Manager at SMEX, the root of the problem is disputes between Lebanon’s telecom companies, Alfa and Touch, and the contracted service providers responsible for managing A2P (Application-to-Person) messaging services.

as a general comment:

many totalitarian or half-totalitarian regimes control internet and tele services way or another. i wouldn’t be surprised if country blocks or alters some sms messages. and other connections if there are not encrypted or secured certain way.

weird point: are some democratic and free countries going to be quarter-totalitarian !?

You could try using a VPN to a country where the verification message does not contain the word “Signal”, Malaysia has been suggested here:

Preventing SMS Verification Blocking by Governments – Some Observations and Suggestions Feature Requests
In some countries with heavy internet censorship (like Iran, China, and Nigeria), blocking Signal isn’t limited to filtering traffic or proxy servers. A more subtle — but arguably more effective — method is being increasingly used: blocking the delivery of verification SMS messages (and calls) during registration. This means that even users with VPNs or Signal’s proxy system can’t sign up or log in, because they simply never receive the verification code. From what I’ve seen, this is a growing …

link_counts.title: Preventing SMS Verification Blocking by Governments – Some Observations and Suggestions

posts.name: Zakaria Ahammed
posts.cooked:
I’m from Bangladesh and have been facing the same issue for the past month. I work at the same local telecom operators, and after checking with our SMSC team, they confirmed this is not on our side. They investigated multiple similar cases and found that no OTP messages from Signal ever reached our SMSC node.

I’ve also noticed a clear pattern:

For new numbers registering Signal for the first time, the verification SMS arrives without any problem.
But for existing users who log out, switch devices, or try to log back in, no verification SMS is received — and the “call me” option doesn’t appear either.

So it looks like an issue on the SMS provider/aggregator side that’s specifically affecting old users in Bangladesh also.

Zakaria_Ahammed:

But for existing users who log out, switch devices, or try to log back in, no verification SMS is received — and the “call me” option doesn’t appear either.

So it looks like an issue on the SMS provider/aggregator side that’s specifically affecting old users in Bangladesh also.

this is very interesting thanks for sharing brother.

I’m a noob btw so wanted to ask: does “sms provider/aggregator” mean it’s NOT an issue on Signal’s end? In which case what would you propose as a solution?

posts.name: Zakaria Ahammed
posts.cooked: 10000028471080×2340 131 KB

rafikinux:

does “sms provider/aggregator” mean it’s NOT an issue on Signal’s end

Yes, that most likely means that your provider either can not or will not deliver the message right now. If you can recieve other SMS at the moment, then your provider might be rejecting the message (probably for political/censorship reasons).

Have you tried the VPN workaround?

It’s also possible that your provider isn’t maliciously preventing you from recieving the code but it’s rather technical issues on their end. That’s why it says to try again later.
my friend in Syria (Syriatel) not receiving code either.
bump… how can we fix this? I’m failing to convert more and more people because of this problem Can’t we get some help from official Signal team? I tried everything.

rafikinux:

Can’t we get some help from official Signal team?

Have you submitted an official support request? This forum is just unofficial support from fellow Signal users who won’t be able to help if there are actual issues with things like SMS being blocked at the carrier level.

oh my mistake, I thought adding the support tag was the official sufficient way.

Could you please direct me to the official support channel?

If you can manage to get a debug log as described here:

https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/articles/360007318591-Debug-Logs-and-Crash-Reports

That would be best.

If you can’t get one you can still submit a support request here:

https://support.signal.org/hc/en-us/requests/new
Hi, I opened a ticket like you suggested but still no response. Any advise?

Unfortunately, it can be quite difficult to reach support sometimes, especially if the issue isn’t relevant to security or current feature developement. There isn’t much that can be done about this.

In the mean time, if you want to get people away from SMS or the green messenger that shall not be named, you could introduce them to https://matrix.org/ and try using that. You can even self-host it if you have a bit of knowledge, but that’s absolutely not necessary.

The bonus here is that (depending on the server) you don’t need a phone number to register, so SMS blocking won’t apply.
that’s really unfortunate… and the solution is very impractical. This will remain a serious block to migrating people onto signal why isnt it given proper attention by the team?

It is unfortunate, yes. However, I wouldn’t call matrix impractical. A bit different to use and harder to explain to people maybe, but I think, if you’re not self-hosting, it’s absolutely a valid solution for non-technical people as well.

SMS blocking is also a difficult issue to solve, because Signal devs have no control over SMS providers. Have you tried the VPN workaround I suggested above?

Signal stopped receiving SMS verification code on Zain Telecom in Jordan. All other Telecom seem to be fine. Called Zain, they said there’s no block on their end. What can we do? How to reach signal team. I already messaged support before and they don’t respond.

posts.name: Kamilia Barmada
posts.cooked:
Hello Signal Community,

I am writing to report a persistent issue with receiving the activation code in Syria. I have been unable to register for several months now.

My Device Technical Details:

* Model: Samsung Galaxy A56 (SM-A566B)

* Android Version: 16

* One UI Version: 8.0

* Build Number: A566BXXS8BZA1

* Security Patch Level: January 1, 2026

* Carrier: MTN Syria

* Location: Syria

Problem Description:

I am not receiving the verification SMS at all, even though I can receive other international SMS and OTPs. The “Call Me” option also does not result in any incoming calls.

Steps Taken:

* Verified that all app permissions (SMS, Phone) are active.

* Tried with and without VPN.

* Cleared app cache and re-installed Signal.

* Confirmed the phone number format is correct (+963…).

I noticed other users in the region (like @rafiklinux) are experiencing the same. Could this be related to a block on the SMS gateway for MTN Syria? I am happy to provide a debug log if needed.

Thank you.
